fieldData.title: Lump-sum payments for unemployed and children
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Support for parents and carers (financial or in kind)
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Austria has experienced record numbers in unemployment as a consequence of the Corona crisis. In their two-day coalition government meeting on 15 and 16 June, the federal government (consisting of the conservative People's Party ÖVP and the Green Party) announced several measures targeted towards boosting the economy, among them one-off payments for unemployed persons and for parents, both in September. The latter are to be supported at the start of the new school year.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: Unemployed persons will receive a one-off payment of €450 in autumn. The condition is that they have received unemployment benefit or emergency unemployment assistance for at least 60 days between May and August. Furthermore, a one-off payment of €360 for each child for whom family allowance is drawn, is paid (i.e. this applies generally to all children up to the year in which they turn 19 years and beyond up to 24 years if they are enrolled in education/training, and to 25 in special cases). Both payments will be made automatically (i.e. no application needed) in September.The measure applies to all persons having been at least 60 days unemployed between May and August 2020 and to all children for whom family allowance is drawn.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: According to the public employment service (AMS) data, only about half (i.e. 370,000) of the estimated 740,000 unemployed and training participants who received unemployment benefit or emergency unemployment assistance between April and August, received the one-off payment of €450. The rest was not eligible as they were either unemployed for less than 60 days, or their unemployment was (partially) before the calculation period between May and August or they were first on short-time work and became unemployed only later, also not meeting the criteria.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: This is a unilateral government measure, the social partners were informed but not consulted.

sources.sources::title: Social Committee gives the green light for one-off payment to the unemployed and for child bonus
Half of all Corona unemployed do not receive one-time payment
National Council: The unemployed receive a further one-off payment of € 450 in December

updates.updates::description: In November, a second one-time lump payment for unemployed was decided in parliament becoming effective in December 2020 and January 2021. The second bonus is staggered: Depending on the duration of unemployment, between €150 and €450 are paid.The maximum amount of €450 is paid to persons with at least 45 reference days of unemployment benefits received between September and November 2020; €300 is paid with at least 30 days of unemployment; and €150 is paid for those with at least 15 days of unemployment. In addition, unemployed people who receive sick pay will also receive a one-off payment this time (they were excluded from the first payment in September).The bonus will be paid in the months of December and January.
